intro: Keramocarpus, commonly known as the rockrose, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. These plants are typically shrubs characterized by their evergreen leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. Keramocarpus species are native to various regions in the Mediterranean, Europe, and North Africa, where they thrive in rocky and well-drained soils. They are often found in coastal areas and mountainous regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens.
